intro: Desmopsis uxpanapensis, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
